sentences.en: An estimated 1600 vessels pass through the strait annually.
sentences.cn: 估计每年有1，600艘船通过该海峡。

sentences.en: But madman who sought war ought to be put in strait jackets.
sentences.cn: 但追求战争的狂人应该统统给他们穿上紧身衣.

sentences.en: Egypt would not interfere with the normal flow of traffic through the strait.
sentences.cn: 埃及不干涉通过这个海峡的正常交通运输.

sentences.en: Ferries ply across a narrow strait to the island.
sentences.cn: 渡船定时穿越狭窄的海峡驶向海岛。

sentences.en: Finally the leading ships steamed in at night through the narrow strait.
sentences.cn: 最后先头船只在夜间驶入狭窄的海峡.

sentences.en: He was criticised for being boring, strait-laced and narrow-minded.
sentences.cn: 他被指无趣乏味，古板守旧，心胸狭窄。

sentences.en: Montgomery slipped two divisions across the Strait of Messina one night against no resistance.
sentences.cn: 蒙哥马利于某晚以两个师偷越墨西拿海峡,并未遭遇抵抗.

sentences.en: My old aunts are very strait - laced.
The house had a fabulous view out to the Strait of Georgia and the Rockies beyond.
sentences.cn: 在这座房子里能看到乔治亚海峡和海峡那边落基山脉的壮美风景。
那位修女立下严格的誓愿.

sentences.en: The sea narrows into a strait.
The ship passed through the strait between two islands.
sentences.cn: 船从两岛之间的海峡穿过.

sentences.en: This invariance requirement has been a strait jacket on the free invention of scientists.
sentences.cn: 这个不变性要求,已经成了套在科学家的自由创造上的一件紧身衣.

sentences.en: What a strait he was in!
Yemen commands the strait at the southern end of the Red Sea.
sentences.cn: 也门完全控制着红海南端的海峡。

trans.tran_cn: 海峡，（常用pl.）窘迫，困境，危难
trans.tran_en: a narrow passage of water between two areas of land, usually connecting two seas
